image.altText: Vents coming out of an old building.

props.synopsis: A WorkSafe investigation is underway after three people were hospitalised, with toxic fumes building up due to 'unsafe' air extraction systems.

title.children: TAFE aware of carbon monoxide problem before three people were hospitalised

image.altText: Right side profile of a female tuba player.

props.synopsis: As a kid, Rachel Kelly saw "all the other girls play the flute" but after battling to make a decent sound on that, turned to the tuba — and now is doing what no other woman has done before.

title.children: Rachel may not one to blow her own horn, but others happy to celebrate orchestra's milestone

image.altText: Macaque monkeys.

props.synopsis: A visit to the 'monkey park' has been a part of this Tasmanian city's appeal since the late 1800s, so what is the history of Launceston's Monkey Island? And does it have a future?

title.children: How Launceston got its monkeys — and why they could be gone within decades

image.altText: A sepia photograph of Amy Sherwin, who is side on to the camera, in 1887

props.synopsis: Known as the "Tasmanian nightingale", Amy Sherwin was Australia's first international opera singer. Today, she is relatively unknown, but there is a push to change that.

title.children: Australia's first big opera star sang for kings and died penniless

image.altText: Bauble in a celery top pine tree.

props.synopsis: A tree is central to many Christmas celebrations, but it doesn't have to be a one-hit-wonder dragged from storage each year or even one that is cut and then recycled after use. A botanist shares her tips on using potted native species.

title.children: Native species that fit the bill for a perfect Christmas tree alternative

image.altText: A satellite image of a large body of ice.

props.synopsis: Australian and international scientists have used satellite imagery to chronicle the collapse of a New York City-sized ice shelf in Antarctica, shedding light on key processes linked to future sea level rise.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Scientists now know how this ice shelf collapsed

image.altText: Sketch of school children at a large table. Four gathered at one end with a teacher and one alone at the other under a spotlight

props.synopsis: Raising a child with exceptional academic potential, perhaps destined solve the world's most pressing problems, sounds like a breeze. But even those who are identified as "gifted" can struggle to find the right path through school.

title.children: Gifted and ignored: The smart kids who can't afford to succeed

image.altText: A man stands in a backyard with his arms crossed, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Gambling reform advocates say greater action is needed to crack down on offshore gambling operators who are illegally targeting Australians, including recovered addicts.

title.children: Australia a 'honey pot' for offshore gambling operators, advocate says

image.altText: A woman wrapped in a green, red, blue and yellow flag of New Caledonia's independence movement.

props.synopsis: The collapse of France's government has thrown New Caledonia into fresh uncertainty as it tries to recover from its worst civil unrest in decades.

title.children: Collapse of France's government risks New Caledonia's fragile recovery

image.altText: A cardinal wearing cardinal robes standing next to a statue inside an old building in the Vatican.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian-born missionary says he aims to be a cardinal who is "flexible, holy, accessible and without eminence".

title.children: Australian-based Ukrainian bishop now world's youngest cardinal at 44

image.altText: A man in a hoodie smiles in cctv footage

props.synopsis: Police say the motive for Brian Thompson's killing is unknown. But it has highlighted threats to those who run America's health insurers, and sparked a conversation about widespread anger at the industry.

title.children: US insurers respond as death of a CEO sparks ghoulish online glee

image.altText: A man's hand drops a bottle containing a sperm into a woman's hand.

props.synopsis: Those powering Facebook's sperm exchange say they want options and they want control. But in this unregulated space, it's not always clear who's in control and who isn't.

title.children: Craig used Facebook to make a baby with strangers, then came torment

image.altText: Raygun

props.synopsis: Raygun: The Musical was set to debut in Sydney this evening at a venue on Oxford Street, in the city's inner east.

title.children: Raygun-inspired musical cancelled over legal threats, comedian says

image.altText: Man putting food waste into a stainless steel drum

props.synopsis: Australia means so much to Iranian-born biotechnologist Sam Jahangard, he has made a huge sacrifice to keep his developments in the country instead of selling them internationally.

title.children: Scientist turns down $500 million to keep waste-to-compost invention in Australia

image.altText: The top three qualifiers for a Formula 1 grand prix stand facing the camera, with two McLaren drivers and a Ferrari driver.

props.synopsis: Australia's Oscar Piastri will start on the front row at the Abu Dhabi GP behind pole-sitting teammate Lando Norris, with McLaren set to become constructors' world champions.

title.children: Norris pips Piastri for F1 pole in McLaren's Abu Dhabi 1-2

image.altText: Travis Head looks up towards the crowd while wearing his baggy green

props.synopsis: As proactive and frenetic as ever, Travis Head enjoyed a day in Adelaide where everything went right and his thrilling knock has set Australia on the path to a critical victory.

title.children: Head knows only full throttle, and it's leading Australia to victory

image.altText: A graphic showing two coloured maps of Australia

props.synopsis: As climate change progresses, the CSIRO has created the first detailed national maps to help Australians understand the future risk to their properties.

title.children: The maps that could 'revolutionise' how Australia handles bushfire risk

image.altText: Tiesha

props.synopsis: A survey finds more than half of people aged 18 to 29 with a credit card sign up solely to earn travel rewards points, but 60 per cent are struggling to clear their debts each month.

title.children: Discounted flights come at cost as young people fail to pay travel reward credit cards

image.altText: Phonics student writes word

props.synopsis: Primary school children are being taught the building blocks of language via a method that has had proven success overseas.

title.children: Victorian students to sit new test as part of move to 'phonics'

image.altText: A male lion with a dark mane.

props.synopsis: The 2014 film The Lion King has a special place in many hearts, but would Simba really end up with Nala? And why is Scar more attractive than Mufasa? We sort Pride Lands fact from fiction.

title.children: What The Lion King got wrong about life in on the savannah

image.altText: A group of people in high vis holding signs.

props.synopsis: The United Workers Union says Woolworths employees across four warehouses have won better rights and wages after being on strike for 17 days.

title.children: Strike ends at Woolies distribution centres as union accepts new offer

image.altText: Clare Polkinghorne waves to the crowd after her final Matildas appearance.

props.synopsis: In their final match of the year, the Matildas keep a clean sheet on their way to a thumping 6-0 victory over Chinese Taipei at Geelong's Kardinia Park.

title.children: Matildas score resounding win in Polkinghorne's international farewell

image.altText: Gout Gout pictured embracing his coach and manager.

props.synopsis: At just 16, Gout Gout removes Peter Norman's national mark that had stood since 1968, producing a faster time than what Usain Bolt ran at the same age.

title.children: Teen sprint star Gout Gout breaks Peter Norman's 56-year national 200m record

image.altText: Mohammed Siraj, Marnus Labuschagne and Virat Kohli on day two of the second Test between Australia and India.

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne broke out of a lengthy slump as Virat Kohli and Mohammed Siraj both lost their cool at different points under the hot Adelaide sun on day two of the second Test.

title.children: Quick hits: Marnus flips the script as Virat and Siraj fire up at boisterous Australian crowd

image.altText: Firefights walk past fire damage and smashed glass at the Synagogue.

props.synopsis: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has linked a Melbourne synagogue firebombing to Australia's UN vote earlier this week.

title.children: Netanyahu singles out Labor government for 'extreme anti-Israel' position

image.altText: Brian Crisp, a caucasian man with a white beard in his early 60s, dressed in a red Santa Claus suit

props.synopsis: Gold Coast grandfather Brian Crisp shares what he learnt in Santa school and how his new profession has given him a greater appreciation for Christmas.

title.children: The lowdown on becoming a professional Santa

image.altText: A large pedestrian bridge with green LIV Golf signage over a dark river with rowers on the right

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has made major events a key part of its agenda, but taxpayers are kept in the dark about how much of public funds are spent promoting them.

title.children: Taxpayers kept in the dark about cost of advertising SA's major events

image.altText: A man (Bill Chalker) sits at a desk examining the RAAF's ufo files

props.synopsis: Bill Chalker was one of the first civilians to access Australia's secret UFO files — but when the day finally came, there was one problem. They hadn't been declassified.

title.children: UFOs over Australia and the military's 'very real-world' concerns

image.altText: Three men on the verandah of the post disaster proto type at Southern Cross University

props.synopsis: Engineers hope easy-to-erect, sustainable cardboard homes may provide the answer to crisis accommodation after floods and bushfires.

title.children: Sustainable cardboard homes may provide post-disaster accommodation

image.altText: SOS written in dirt nearby water way

props.synopsis: A couple, aged in their 50s, have been rescued after their four-wheel drive was washed away in crocodile-infested floodwaters in north-west Queensland.

title.children: Couple survive 40-degree heat and croc-infested waters after outback stranding

image.altText: Smoke and flames appears in the background of land across the water creating an orange glow in the night sky.

props.synopsis: The 800-hectare Helms Arboretum is a popular destination for weddings and nature lovers, but will remain closed for major rehabilitation works after bushfire ripped through much of the area.

title.children: First day of summer bushfires damages arboretum home to 100yo trees

image.altText: Hongchi Xiao

props.synopsis: An alternative healer imprisoned in Australia who advocated "slapping therapy" to treat a range of illnesses was sentenced to 10 years in UK prison for the death of a 71-year-old diabetic woman.

title.children: Slapping healer convicted in Australia jailed over death of UK woman

image.altText: A man in a grey suit poses with his chin in his hand

props.synopsis: The Constitutional Court's unprecedented decision came after Romania's president declassified intelligence that alleged Russia ran a coordinated social media campaign to promote a far-right outsider.

title.children: Romanian court annuls election votes after Russian interference fears

image.altText: Seen from above, a young child sits on a rug on the floor looking at a book that is blurred.

props.synopsis: From picture books that won't drive adults wild re-reading them endlessly, to the best graphic novels and young adult books, writer Lefa Singleton Norton has your summer of reading with young people covered.

title.children: Whimsy, kitty-noir and queer romance: Top picks for younger readers
